context.p: The steps in this procedure show you the basics of using Synopsys Bridge to run scans. The example command below is from a Polaris integration. For the details of Synopsys Bridge calls to other Synopsys security scanning tools, see Schema Resources And Extensions for a list of Synopsys Bridge resources and Black Duck or Coverity Connect integration topics for the details of launching scans with those products.

step.cmd: Add Synopsys Bridge to your PATH environment variable.
If you haven't already done so, create an access token. The method by which you create a token may vary depending on which Synopsys security product you're integrating.
Select the code base directory to scan and pass your Synopsys Bridge arguments using either a JSON file or passing arguments on the command line.
Synopsys Bridge sends an exit code indicating the results of the scan. See the Exit Code table.
